com.almasb.fxgl.ui

Class InGameWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.control.Control
            • jfxtras.scene.control.window.Window
              • com.almasb.fxgl.ui.InGameWindow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget, javafx.scene.control.Skinnable, jfxtras.scene.control.window.SelectableNode

    public class InGameWindow
extends jfxtras.scene.control.window.Window
    Represents an in-game window as part of game UI. This is only intended to be used as a pane for UI controls, i.e. non-game scene view elements.

    Can be attached to game scene as follows: 

             InGameWindow window = new InGameWindow("Title");
         getGameScene().addUINode(window);

    Author:
    Almas Baimagambetov (AlmasB) (almaslvl@gmail.com)
